entryInfo.title: Introductory information
entryInfo.text1: Welcome to the magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) laboratory. MRI is a modern medical imaging method that, unlike X-rays, does not use ionizing radiation. The purpose of this method is to monitor the behaviour of tissues and organs in a strong magnetic field. An increased noise level accompanies the measurement. The examination itself is not painful, but electronics or metal material in the body or on its surface could be potentially risky and potentially harmful due to the interaction with the device. Therefore, it is essential for your safety to follow the MR machine operators' instructions and to answer the following questions truthfully. Feel free to ask the operators if you have any questions or uncertainties.
entryInfo.text2: It is important to follow the operator's instructions during the examination. In particular, try to minimize any movement of your body during the measurement.

safetyInfo.title: Safety information
safetyInfo.textPart1: Please read the following questions and mark the correct answers.
safetyInfo.textPart2: Answering the questions truthfully is very important for your safety!

examinationConsent.title: Consent to the examination in the Multimodal and Functional Imaging Laboratory
examinationConsent.text1: I hereby declare that I have read and understood the information about the MRI examination (pages 1 to 2 of this document). I declare that I have truthfully answered the questionnaire. I declare that I have been instructed about the research study to which this examination belongs by a member of the research team and through independent informed consent, and I agree with the measurement.
examinationConsent.text2: I agree to provide my personal data to the extent of my full name, signature, date of birth, personal identification number, gender, handedness, height, weight, vision correction, native language, safety questions on MR contraindications from this questionnaire, the collected data and contact information (in case of incidental findings according to the informed consent of the study). Based on the legitimate interest of the processor – Masaryk University – to ensure the necessary safety and legal requirements related to the examination in the Multimodal and Functional Imaging Laboratory, the personal data will be stored for 5 years in secure storage of Masaryk University with limited access. After this time, all data stored in the Multimodal and Functional Imaging Laboratory will be anonymized.
